reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is nothing short of disgusting. The foyer (really just a lounge room with a desk) is full of old mismatched worn out furniture. Our room was located at the back of the hotel and as soon as we opened the door we could smell that dank smell of mould and dust. The room itself was small and again full of old furniture and carpet. There was only one small window which was located inside the shower and it took quite a bit of effort to force it open.
reviews.title: Warning... do not stay here!

likes.liked: — The bed that had a severe sag in the middle
likes.disliked: — The mouldy smell of the room

reviews.text: The shower looked like it was a converted cupboard with slat doors, that couldn't close properly, in place of a shower curtain. I suspect this is partially why the place smelt so bad as the water would invariably run straight onto the carpet. The toilet was seperate (thankfully) but it was small and virtually impossible to escape without bumping your head against the wall at some point.
reviews.title: Nice hotel Friendly staff

likes.liked: — The rooms where cleaned every day and afcourse the staff was friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was this rooms crowning glory (not). It was either broken in two or it had a severe sag in the middle which gave us both backache. The last straw was when I woke up in the middle of the night with my face up against the wall breathing in the most digusting smell of mould.
reviews.title: Very Pleasing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say we checked out after one night and I regret not doing it when we first sited the room. What added insult to injury was that we were led to believe this was a gay owned or at least gay friendly hotel. There is nothing to distinguish this hotel from any other and got the impression it was just a marketing ploy to pull more business.
reviews.title: Yuck
